pros: Working with vulnerable populations-- homeless, HIV, minorities, mental health problems, etc.
cons: A lot of patients don't keep their appointments, too stressful

pros: remote flex hours remote remote
cons: Needs some help in all Departments Better Pay -do three peoples job and get paid for one

review_title: Good place to gain experience but burnout central.
pros: Great place to gain experience as a new MA.
cons: Understaffed, overworked, underfunded and underpaid. Moral is terrible. Providers are overwhelmed with amount of patients and the company demands. Burnout is way too common here.

pros: They have great benefits and good salary.
cons: Management has seemed to come and go,hardly there for very long. Communication between departments is lacking.

review_title: Horrible management and non-existent internal communication
job_title: Behavioral Health Clinician in Sacramento, CA
pros: The salary for social workers is very high compared to other agencies, and many staff here care deeply for their work and the populations they serve.
cons: Management does not care about providers' feedback. This place is burnout central. The behavioral health clinic is disgusting and poorly maintained. The workload is excessive. There is almost no administrative support for clinicians. Departments are siloed and do not communicate with one another.

review_title: Go to Sacramento Native American Healthcare Center

pros: some effective and knowledgeable medical providers
cons:
sub-standard board of directors and top leadership
questionable behavioral health leadership and entry level workers
monthly revolving door of employees leaving, sub-par retention
non-trauma informed care practices

job_title: Referral Coordinator in Hood River, OR
pros: 5 weeks of PTO, great work life balance.
cons: Company has a lot of favoritism.

review_title: Too much upper and mid-level turnover
job_title: Business Intelligence Developer in Sacramento, CA
pros: Remote Options and flexible hours.
cons: Some upper level mangers are bullies. Very poor leadership.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Hood River, OR
pros: Family friendly, Clinic hours. Accommodative to empowering employees.
cons: Top Heavy. Too many managers. Inefficient lower level support staff.

pros: They still provide service to the community.
cons: Not a place I would refer to.

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Sacramento, CA
pros: Great work life balance and great culture
cons: Low wages, patients can be very rude and demanding. Senior management

review_title: It’s ok, but don’t plan on staying more than a year
pros: You are paid every two week and benefits
cons: Chaotic, high stress, high turnover, top heavy,  few leaders actually come down from their high seats to see what’s happening.

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Sacramento, CA
pros: The satisfaction of being able to help patients in need.
cons: Not always have the resources to help the patients in need.

pros: Benefits and HR TEAM very supportive
cons: The employees who really work hard are rarely looked at. You can give your all and no one will look at your pay or how hard you are working due to the turnaround. Anyone can say something about you and people higher up will listen and never give you a real chance. They only look at the people who complain not the people that don't. Feels like the squeeky will gets attention

pros: This company rewards staff and management who have drive with the desire to improve our operations.  Major changes of both personnel and clinic operations is truly testing the strength of the organization.  You can truly present an idea, review and be encouraged to develop this to see if it has merit for inclusion for the business operations.  Not many small organizations have this much to allow staff at all levels to work on design and implementation of new ideas.
cons: Not a place to just park and keep a chair warm.

pros: One Community Health is going through a wonderful transformation.  From changing our name from Cares Community Health to One Community Health to the addition of exciting new providers and necessary staff to support them, I feel that we have the best in the field to provide the best quality care to our patients.  I love being a part of the team and look forward to want is on the horizon.
cons: People will always find something negative to say about their employer, but I honestly feel that we identify issues before they get out of hand and put a toll on the employee.   Management is very assertive.

pros:
The people that work here are here for the patients. They work hard at giving high quality care to the patients that they see daily. 
Coming from out of state I was worried about the interview process. They worked with me and my times and we did everything over Skype. That reduced the stress of having to take time off work and traveling. Once hired the HR and credentialing staff  worked with me to make sure everything was done in a timely manner. I feel I made the right choice in taking this position.
cons: Some of the on boarding forms could be updated

review_title: Cares Community Health does really care for their employees.
pros: Extreme diverse work culture, 401 K matching.
cons:
Poor management, poor Board of Directors and top management who are trying to lead a non profit corporation for profit.
Management demeans employees, is biased, unethical, lies to the employees, and doesn't train it's staff but holds them accountable to be perfect.
Wages for hourly employees are pennies on the dollar while the CEO, COO and it's Directors all make 6 figures. 
If employees move on to other companies, Cares does not reimburse for the sick time you have accrued; they keep it.

pros: Staff is amazing, friendly, helpful and they like working there. They take a lot of pride in their service to the community and it shows with patient feedback.
cons: Cons only if you don't like to work hard in a fast paced environment and in a team settings.

pros: Some employees are very patient centered, Ok benefits, expanding services, room for growth, saving lives, stopping the spread of HIV.
cons: Poor leadership, poor planning, expanding too rapidly for capacity, lack of team work. Many employees are not friendly or nice to each other. Decisions are not made by a team or collaborative effort. Extremely low morale, lack of employee recognition and development.

job_title: Customer Service Supervisor in Sacramento, CA
pros: Amazing company to work for. Great Managers and Leadership. HR easy to work with due to the breakdown of duties. Your voice matters. There is 0 mistreatment of employees/staff.  I really enjoy working for a sincere company with sincere values.
cons: I need more hours in a day. I don't like to go home because I absolutely LOVE MY JOB!

job_title: Clinical Nurse Manager in Sacramento, CA
pros: On-boarding process was smooth, warm working environment, organization is very passionate about their mission, definite place to work to serve your community with work/life balance.
cons: The organization is going through growing pains BUT for the right reasons...its patient population that they serve.

review_title: More than a job, it’s a family!!
job_title: Integrated Behavioral Health Manager in Sacramento, CA
pros: I love how we share a common goal of providing optimal services to our patients while also supporting each other throughout the work day!
cons: I have yet to find perfection in anything alive yet I think that One Community Health comes close enough and does not appear to run from a challenge!

review_title: I love this company to its fullest!!
job_title: Mental Health Therapist in Sacramento, CA
pros: I love that this company has given me opportunities to expand my skills and the willingness of my supervisors to allow me to grow in work areas I choose to enhance!
cons: There are none to submit!!

job_title: Registered Dental Assistant in Sacramento, CA
pros: Walking distance to various places to eat and transportation.
cons: Poor Management. High risk, low pay.

review_title: Amazing and very rewarding place to work.
pros: We go the distance to assist our patients needs to make them feel welcome and safe.
cons: Like any clinic that is in the expansion faze we have growing pains that will soon deliver to Sacramento an amazing state of the art new clinic.

pros: Dynamic and engaged leadership, competitive salaries, new ideas/innovation are welcomed, growth is supported, team based care, no RVU's so I can really take care of patients and serve the community
cons: Growing and ambitious organization which can sometimes generate ambiguity and changing  goals

job_title: Medical Case Manager in Sacramento, CA
pros: A place to grow and learn, great patient care, wonderful staff, and so many with a passion for caring for patients.
cons: Growing to fast that we lose our personal touch
